parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Engine Failure Due to Connecting Rod Bearing Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the connecting rod bearing can cause the engine to seize, resulting in a loss of motive power, increasing the risk of a crash or fire.
symptoms: The engine makes a knocking or grinding noise
the vehicle loses power
the check engine light is illuminated
and oil is leaking from the engine.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Engine Failure Due to Engine Management Component Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the engine management component can cause the engine to stall or seize, resulting in a loss of motive power, increasing the risk of a crash or fire.
symptoms: The engine stalls or loses power
the check engine light is illuminated
and the vehicle may experience a sudden loss of acceleration.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Excessive engine oil consumption can lead to engine failure, resulting in a loss of motive power, increasing the risk of a crash or fire.
symptoms: The engine consumes excessive amounts of oil
the oil light is illuminated
and the vehicle may experience a sudden loss of power.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Failure to Notify Owners of Recalls
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure to notify owners of recalls can lead to engine failure, resulting in a loss of motive power, increasing the risk of a crash or fire.
symptoms: Owners are not notified of recalls
despite the vehicle being eligible for repair or replacement under the recall.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the turbocharger can cause the vehicle to lose power, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: The turbocharger stops working
the vehicle smokes
the clutch pedal feels soft or spongy
the vehicle is unable to shift into gear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the clutch system can cause the vehicle to lose power, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: The clutch pedal feels soft or spongy
the clutch pedal sticks to the floor
the vehicle is unable to shift into gear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Excessive oil consumption can cause engine damage, leading to costly repairs or even engine failure.
symptoms: The vehicle consumes excessive amounts of oil
the low oil pressure warning light fails to illuminate
the engine makes an abnormal sound.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the HVAC system can cause a fire hazard, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The blower fan only blows slightly
the knob does not work
the wiring for the temperature control knob is faulty
the AC control switch melts
smoke comes out of the dash.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electrical system can cause a fire hazard, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The AC control switch melts
the wiring for the temperature control knob is faulty
the plug that connects to the AC control unit is burned and damaged.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the transmission can cause the vehicle to lose power, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: The vehicle hesitates and bucks violently while accelerating
the gear light blinks on the dashboard
the vehicle won't go into gear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the engine can cause the vehicle to lose power, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: The vehicle stalls due to engine overheating
the engine makes an abnormal sound.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure to address safety recalls can cause accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The vehicle is included in a safety recall
but the repair is not available or is delayed.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering coupler can cause the steering wheel to become loose, making it difficult to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or loss of vehicle control.
symptoms: The steering wheel feels loose
the steering wheel clicks or clunks when turned
the steering wheel vibrates
the steering wheel sticks or has a delayed return to its normal position
the vehicle drifts or wanders while driving.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: ABS and Traction Control System Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS and Traction Control System can cause the vehicle to lose traction, making it difficult to control, which can lead to accidents or loss of vehicle control.
symptoms: The ABS and Traction Control lights come on and off randomly
the vehicle's speedometer and gas gauge malfunction
the steering wheel becomes hard to turn
the vehicle's electrical system malfunctions
causing smoke and a burning smell.
